author: Digital-pyro
title: Mental health adult and child cancelled assessment
body:
Last March 2020 when this began my son's mental health support for self harm was cancelled. He was 12. My sons autism support was cancelled. He's at stage 3 of the education plan.  
My neurological diagnosis clinic was cancelled leaving me unsure of what is wrong with me continuing stress no pain medication no treatment plan for a year.  
Pain clinic cancelled.  
My mental health support was cancelled.  
My face to face for diagnosis was cancelled.  
My mental health diagnosis support was cancelled.  
My gp would not see me for the whole of 2020 I had to pay private for a cancer biopsy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Beryl 43
title: Lack of available appointments
body:
Whenever you phone for an appointment you‚Äôre always way down the queue, you hang on & hang on and when you get through there‚Äôs nothing available.  
They never give the option to go to a hub, just ring back at 8am tomorrow!  
You can ask for a GP to call you but you can spend the day by the phone as they don‚Äôt know their AM from PM.  
It often seems like GPs are more concerned with doing minor procedures at other practices or working at the local hospitals rather than attending this surgery.

author: grandma Jenkins
title: Hospital Consultant referral for palliative care
body:
my partner was discharged into palliative care in February 2021, after presenting in June 2019 at doctors and seeing a consultant in December 2019, we were told that treatment would be completed by March 2020. There are on average 12 cases of anal cancer per year in Leicester and that 90% were treated with a successful outcome. Unable to have chemo therapy a course of radiotherapy began in June 2020, numerous cancellations and delays of consultations, assessments and apointments meant that the cancer caused rapid deterioration of the health of my partner, he was unable to walk more than a few steps without excruciating pain, lie on his back or front or sit at all.  
On hospital visits (including one that was cancelled by phone that morning when he was upstairs and couldn‚Äôt reach the landline and had no mobile and I was at hospital myself from 7.30am until 12 resulting in us attending at great cost to stress and physical health) we were told there was no possibility of having a trolley to take him to wards, consults, appointments resulting in more injury and strain on his anal, rectum areas where his cancer was progressing. After refusing him an operation at The Spires,(more travelling, visits and assessments, more deterioration in health, the consultant decided to operate himself as an emergency at the Royal in Leicester. The operation, including restorative plastic surgery, took place in December 2020. They removed his anus, rectum, ulcer and tumour and surgically placed a Stoma bag  
8th-14th in hospital, had to return to see consultant weekly more travel more walking, still no trolley to the Jarvis or other wards, still the receptionists and others saying a trolley was not possible, in one case saying it could take upto an hour when the appointment was in 10 minutes. I pointed out red spot where there had been none the week before to the consultant and that the wound, from start of buttocks to back of scrotum was still discharging faecal matter, was told not to worry by nurse unless it turned green. A dressing was placed by the nurse occasionally. This never lasted more than a day.  
A biopsy was booked, more travelling, walking to assessment, operation, to hear result. We were told nothing more could bedone and my partner was discharged to the GP for palliative care. we were told by the consultant that a doctor would attend and a nurse would come every day. He was to continue with morphine and the pain management team would possibly be able to control the pain so he might be able to sit eventually. No timeline was given, though it was suggested upto 5 years might be possible if the cancer did not spread further, but it had recurred. The nurse said the consultant might be out of touch with home provision now Covid altered everything.  
. The Stoma nurses had been in contact and shown my partner how to replace his Stoma bag, not shown me, even though he was on morphine patches and was to increase dosage of oral morphine. I am bi polar, controlled by medication, have arthritis and foot problems. We are both 71.  
Feb23/21 he was referred back to GP, with bigger and more widespread unhealed wound. All his follow up consultations with the plastic surgeon were cancelled because of Covid, and when we were offered an appointment he was too ill to travel and had been referred back to Gp. A district nurse attended, due Monday. 4pm (I can‚Äôt remember if it was then or Wednesday) she had been told to dress a wound, no more information, the dressing wasn‚Äôt big enough to cover the whole wound and the discharge had increased. My partner complained that the pain was unbearable and asked me to take off the plaster dressing the next day, it was soiled and dripping. Another district nurse came on Sunday afternoon the 7th asked if he wanted a dressing, when he said no because it hurt too much she took a photo of the top of the wound and said she would come round next Friday as he could only get daily visits for wound dressing.  
Meantime we had a phone call from Macmillan's to tell us that the person responsible for assessing referrals was unavailable so no one could deal with us now, but we could expect a call from them on Monday 1st March. The call came and we were asked about his pain relief and told to note down the amount and time of his oral morphine medication so she had a better idea of dosage. We were both annoyed that other questions we had were not heard, it seemed to be a closed phone call. My partner only having gone out to hospital since November 2019 in pain, being deaf in one ear and having the other filling up with wax and his eyesight needing another eye test and glasses as he could no longer see the TV was told he must try to find people to come out to see him himself. We both wanted a Macmillan nurse to inspect and advise on his difficulties.  
The follow up call on Thursday never happened, or at least no message was left on the machine. We had a hospital bed arrive on Tuesday 9th March that we couldn‚Äôt adjust ourselves, but wait until the district nurse came next to adjust. The air mattress was too hard for my partner who was developing pressure sores on hips, elbows and knees from being on his side for the past year and more, he had to suffer some more. That Tuesday his Stoma Bag burst in bed, he is a very private person and did his bag himself and I cleaned the mess everywhere else. Wednesday and Thursday he had fallen from the bed twice as he leaned forward to ease the pressure, was clammy on his forehead and when he was sick I got the doctor to call, who sent him straight to AandE. he has been kept in, with no visitors, after we had hoped to enjoy every moment left of being together.  
Because of the stress and the experience of waiting constantly for the next appointment/treatment over the last 20 months I am pleased that my daughter and sister who live in Leicester have been supporting me by providing transport to the hospital for my partner and to my own appointments. My foot problems make life difficult. I can‚Äôt get up without assistance myself when I kneel, and find it difficult to bend to pick up dropped items, or to clean the floor properly, or to climb stairs, often 12 or more times a day checking on my partner, going to the bathroom with him,  
taking him medication and food. Plus I am exhausted every day just cooking, cleaning and shifting furniture, we have a 3story house with steps front and back. I haven‚Äôt been able to get a doctors appointment for myself often and when I do it‚Äôs 1 patient I problem (and I Have Many)  
I appreciate that the NHS and Charities have suffered greatly in the last decade or more by the evil and inhumane funding cuts by the government, as well as Covid being mismanaged by the inept and incompetent, wasting billions mainly on cronyism and business interests. The dismantling of the NHS and Education systematically has caused lots of (perhaps) unintended consequences, but the price being paid in blood and suffering cannot be compensated for by the incredible service being shown by our overworked underpaid or not paid in the face of such calamity. It is unfair. Everyone I have met in the health service has impressed by their dedication, kindness, empathy (except for their ignorance about anal cancer) and care. The break down between services seems again deliberate government policy.  
Anyway I am back waiting, in seclusion, with limited IT skills and no mobile, a State pensioner, there are many more just like me, waiting sometimes with no hope of relief or any hope. Thanks to the work Macmillans try to do it is bearable.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

links.id: staff able to connect with distressed patients

author: matnh65
title: X-ray of my foot as I am diabetic
body: I recently went for a X-ray of my foot as I am diabetic. I arrived at the diabetic clinic and waited quite a while to see someone. Once I was finally seen I was told I needed a x-ray of my foot. This wouldn't be a problem if the X-ray department was close, however I had to walk to the other side of the hospital with my bad foot. When I arrived I waited again to be seen to be called into the room and be told my bandages need to be off for the x-ray? I had to go all the way back to the diabetic clinic, wait again, take my bandages off and walk back to X-ray for my X-rays. After my X-rays I had to go BACK AGAIN to the clinic to get them put my bandages back on and then I could finally go home. How this is a normal process for patients especially ones with bad feet is beyond me.

title: Great experience
body: I saw the nurse for a health review and it was all done quickly, in a friendly way and very efficiently

title: Covid jab: excellent and lovely team
body: I arrived for my Covid jab yesterday staffed by brilliant volunteers and excellent NHS staff. So well organised. It was thorough, quick and friendly. A sincere thank you üôè .

author: industj66
title: Breast care unit
body: I was referred to the Kettering breast care unit just over a year ago. The care, advice and support I was given was second to none.   Those in the unit are a credit to the NHS and I cannot thank them enough for the treatment I received.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Keith J
title: Medical staff at Day Care Ward
body: I have been visiting this ward for about 3 months and the medical staff have all ben professional, caring, polite and they all put the patient first.

author: RMFRP
title: Covid 19 vaccine
body: I felt great after taking the Pfizer vaccine. Didn't have any reaction, my main concern was I had allergy reaction to some food in the past. I had some local pain for a day or two nothing more.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Pat22
title: Virtual visiting
body: My husband was admitted to daisy hill the virtual visit is fantastic you get to speak to ur loved ones the two ladies I spoke to tiara and Sylia to organise the virtual visit went over and beyond to sort out times and dates

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: phaseqw58
title: Acute Care at Home team
body:
We cannot let the opportunity pass without reaching out to you and pass on our thoughts and opinions on the recent involvement of the Acute Care at Home team with our Mother during her recent illness.  
We had never heard of the Acute Care at Home Team until then. To say it was a pleasure to meet such dedicated and professional staff would be an understatement. As soon as they arrived at my Mother's home they immediately set my Mother and our families mind at ease as we could see they were going to do all they could to help her. Within a 24 hour period we were astounded at the amount of care and tests our mother had recieved.. Mummy was first visited by Deputy Sister Aisling, a complete breath of fresh air, just what our Mother needed at that time.. Aisling and her personality were like a tonic in itself. Aisling was joinned by Dr Meg a very gentle. Warm. thorough and commited young Dr. Meg took time to explain all the blood tests etc that Mum was having done. Aisling took time to sit down with the family and explain all that would be happening with Mum and the Acute Care at Home Team going forward. The following day all the team assembled again with Consultant Dr Anne another extremely warm and professional Dr taking time to question Mum thoroughly about her illness.. Offer encouragement. Instill confidence and explain all tests she was going to go through.. The attention Mum recieved was second to none over the next few days the team were assisted by Barry, Emma, Diane, Fiona, Collette.(ECG technician) Anna-Marie,(physio) Louise (Dietitian) and Catherine (Pharmacist) & Dr Mc Caffrey Consultant Geriatrician. Each one exactly like the others truly professional and attentive. The team left absolutely no stone left unturned regarding reaching a diagnosis and treatment of Mum. They constantly kept us updated with any results they had recieved.. Our Mothers progress and recovery we put down 100% to the excellent care she has recieved. We consider the Acute Care at Home Teams approach and delivery of care the Rolls Royce standard. It was a pleasure for our Mother and each of us to deal with all its members everyday. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for all you have done. We will continue to sing your praises foreverThank you so much

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: TheoSienna
title: Professional but relaxed
body: I had my first visit recently. I wanted to say a big Thank You to all the staff there. They made me welcome and treated me with respect in a professional but relaxed way. Everything was explained in a way that I could understand it. Wonderful experience.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Dean2786
title: Anxiety & Depression
body:
As a man we are told we are meant to be the strong ones and we don‚Äôt let things bother us and keep things in.  
When I was 12 years old I sadly lost my mum to breast cancer. My mum had been battling for a very long time and sadly she passed away. While my mum was battling cancer I was also helping my mum. If she needed a drink, food or help to sit up or changing her dressings. When my mum died part of me died with her, I shut my feelings down buried my emotions. I couldn't bear talking about it. I had support from my family but choose not to tell them not realising that this would come to the surface later.  
I am now 35 and have a family and been divorced for 5-6 years which was a very nasty break up. In that time I started to get anxiety. My chest started to beat really fast. It was so fast as if I was about to be sick and found it hard to relax things would worry me and it would be chasing around in my head. I was starting to have anxiety attacks. It got to a point I was scared to go to work and it affected my work.  
I was put in touch with Inclusion Thurrock from my doctor, I needed help, I was at my lowest and I can honestly say this was the best thing I ever did. The people that phoned me for an assessment was so kind, caring and prepared to wait when you are crying. Then they decided what sort of therapy would be best. There will be 3 group meetings to do first. This was done by google classroom (but in normal times would have been face to face). This is to get you ready for therapy and what to expect. Then you get contacted by your therapist to arrange therapy. I am now on path which I never thought I‚Äôd be on now. If you want to change what ever you're going through this is the best place to help you.

author: Crick
title: South Lanarkshire Council Social worker
body:
For the last month I have been trying to get in contact with Social work in East Kilbride regarding my mother moving from North Lanarkshire to South Lanarkshire, To try and get home care services she requires in place for move to new flat.  
I have phoned 6 times in last 2 weeks firstly to be told be by very abrupt person on phone that this would involve 6 weeks money to be paid for transfer of care and nothing could be started until we got North Lanarkshire to request and give details and they ended call.  
The last few times have called have been transferred to wrong department no less than 4 times never getting to correct department.  
All during this my mum is sitting in a property which could be unsuitable for her current mobility having to negotiate stairs all this while she a falls risk

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: kilty37
title: I would like to thank all the staff
body:
I went through a separation after 28yrs with my partner after trying to commit suicide. I lost my home, family, job, everything and started drinking more and more, I was in temporary accommodation, and started drinking everyday, first a bottle of wine, then started having 2 a day but not everyday. I eventually got a place of my own, and loved it, but the drinking was still out of hand, didn't drink during week just Friday Saturday and Sunday, I always enjoyed a drink and worked on the pub and nightclub scene for years, I realised that this was getting out of hand and also I didn't realise i was type 2 diabetic, (I was also HIV 27 years). Anyway my doctor told me I need to sort this out at the GU Clinic, and she also mentioned that they had recently done a conference at the local CGL in Notts about drugs and alcohol, etc, so advised me to go there. It took a while to get up enough courage BUT I DID IT, I met a lady call Dot, who talked me through my mental health, my loss and also about my alcohol intake, I started on medication to stop the cravings and had Alan and John ring me very week then every 2 weeks, they helped me loads they seemed to care about me, and it has helped me, I AM CLEAN, there were 2 minor hick-ups, BUT 1 glass of wine and again weeks later, But now I've been clean for 5 months am not on medication, and I seem to be in a better place, I can go into my supermarket and walk down the aisle and come out with NO DRINK YIPEEEE.  
So I would like to thank ALL the staff at C.G.L Worksop especially, Dot, Alan and John for all their support and kind words, and especially all through the lockdowns since last year. I can say I am clean I am now off their books but have been told that if I need their help I only have to ring them. Thank you all so much.

author: Lyndon13
title: My experience from GP to PPH.
body:
One day at the end of February at 2pm I went to see my GP with breathing problems by 2:30pm I was admitted to PPH with possible heart problems as I have past history of heart attacks.  
I was admitted to ward 4. I have never had such excellent treatment in all the years I have been ill. The staff on ward 4 were the nicest kindest and most knowledgeable staff I have ever known. I was only in ward 4 for 3 days in that time I had tests x-rays scans and diagnosed with lung cancer. Since being diagnosed I have returned for further tests and am awaiting the results as I write. I am 70 years of age and feel I have had the best service that anyone could ever wish for.  
Thank you to everyone at PPH for the magnificent way I was treated and treatment to come.

author: #ankle
title: Lovely and friendly
body:
Pauline and Susan visited me just before I left the Trauma Ward in Craigavon hospital.  
I was fitted with a line for home IV treatment. The ladies were lovely and friendly and put me at my ease. Pauline fitted the line professionally and painlessly - a great job indeed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hanbanana
title: Covid Vaccination
body: I went in for my vaccination last week, and afterwards I had a fainting episode. The nurse with red hair Megan looking after me was very kind, reassuring and friendly! She came to check on me after her shift had ended and offered to walk me to my car, just a reflection of one of the many amazing staff working there! Very well organised and socially distanced! Well done: )

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Marxs98
title: Difference between wards
body: I have stayed on both Ward L24 and L25. In ward L25, the day room is bigger and has chairs you can actually sit down on. There is a TV, books and games. The bays are set out better so there is less noise. The bays are bigger. The views are better. The lights aren't massively over bright. The toilets are more evenly spaced throughout the ward.

links.id: ward l24 - the ladies neurosurgery ward

author: magpiefc77
title: Pregnancy
body: I had my scan at 20 weeks of pregnancy as is normal with no concerns raised. At 25weeks I had some light bleeding and went to maternity assessment. The consultant scanned me as there was no record of my placenta position in my 20week scan notes. The consultant explained that there was an extra lobe on my placenta but wanted to get another consultant to review this. The second consultant confirmed that my placenta was low lying and showed me the second lobe on the scan. I‚Äôve recently had a 32week scan to check the position of the placenta to determine how I progress from here. That scan has shown that the placenta has moved up sufficiently and that there is no evidence at all of a lobe. The consultant who saw me after the 32week scan explained that there had been nothing recorded in my notes by either of the consultants who saw me at 25weeks? That they‚Äôd only documented that placenta was low-lying. I have been worrying for a month or so and am now really confused as to why the concern about the lobe was never documented- it is not something I had ever heard about before so it wouldn‚Äôt have entered my head unless they‚Äôd raised it. My pregnancy is reverting to green path which is great but I‚Äôm now riddled with doubt about what was observed and why my notes vary so drastically from what was communicated verbally? Worried more now that I will be anxious through rest of pregnancy and labour because of doubt over what the truth is!

author: cetuskt46
title: Haematology
body: Dr Finnegan and clinical nurse specialist Caroline are fabulous. I have been a patient for a few years and both provide me with a safety net between visits. Caroline is always at the end of the phone to answer any questions or just listen. Both are there at my review appointments if I need anything. With covid they are still there with the added option of phone or video review. A credit to the NHS

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Worth
title: Visit to see nurse for bloods
body: I have always been supportive of my practice and written excellent reviews on Google. But yesterday I went to the surgery to have bloods taken from the nurse as I have just been diagnosed with breast cancer and have an operation upcoming. The nurse I saw did not even greet me and did not respond when I said hello and explained I have surgery coming up. I am 71 now and live alone, facing treatment for cancer, and every single person I have seen in other medical facilities has been really lovely and kind. I came home feeling very upset and tearful which is not like me. Actually, in retrospect I feel sorry for the staff. They did make one comment about the light in the room being bad - and it was. How can you take blood samples in such poor light? Can't the surgery get a decent lamp in the room?

author: do something positive
title: Facing and owning my addiction
body:
Last year I had a psychotic episode. After being a dependent user of cannabis for well over 5 years and using it for 20 years the paranoia and insecurity finally caught up with me.  
I had been given some "weed" but one of the paramedics that attended on the night suggested that it may have been something other than just weed...  
I was taken to A+E and was assessed and later discharged. During the assessment, I was offered some counseling through change grow live and before the lady even finished the sentence I knew I needed the support of CGL.  
My circumstances are probably different to a lot of people but everyone's story is different i suppose I lost my job, my independence my pride, and what little confidence I had was completely stripped away. Anger and escape was the reason I started using full time. A chance to escape my situation and float away into oblivion often starting first thing in the morning.  
I knew I had a dependency on cannabis but never thought it was a problem. I mean, I was only doing myself harm, and yeah I was short-tempered and unless you knew me the image I must have projected was of a bitter and angry person.  
I had been offered help from the Healthcare profession in the past but never really committed to any of the services offered, lack of trust, and ultimately preferring to work my own problems out through introspection and a doob. Hearing the voice in my head which was as clear a conversation you'd have with anyone put the fear of God into me and on the night I sent a text to someone I knew and trusted basically saying if I didn't get help immediately I was going to harm myself. I mean, hearing voices isn't normal, and thankfully my recovery started that night.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: octanseb73
title: Vaccination Programme Support
body:
Today your receptionist Mr Hull went above and beyond to help me secure patient transport and an appointment for a patient's COVID 19 Vaccination. He was diligent, fast and reliable, following up with confirmation in under 24 hours and I'm pleased to say we'll be seeing the patient in question very soon.
Many thanks!

title: Great let down
body: 4 1/2 months of chasing and asking, to find out a promised refrral had not been made! Despite having been told by reception and the Practice manager and the Dr that it had. In reality my family and my daughter had been (had).

title: Light Therapy -Basford
body: Excellent service, staff professional, polite , pleasant and helpful. Appointments on time, which is brilliant and car parking facilities üëç

title: Allendale SuperStars
body: We as a family have been visiting Allendale surgery for a long time the staff there have been caring and understanding with our issue's during the recent Covid pandemic despite the pressure the staff have been professional and most helpful to us. We are grateful for this and appreciate what they do for us and the local community and hope they keep up the same level of service.

title: Caring professionalism
body: Nothing is left to chance, SMP always make every effort to get to the cause and they demonstrate genuine care to anyone who has a problem- no matter how small.

title: COVID VACCINE
body: Phone call Wednesday, appointment Friday. Very well organised - welcomed/directed to vaccine room, seen almost immediately and on my way home within minutes.

title: Covid rules
body:
Covid rules ? 
Its hard to follow the covid restrictions if the staff themself seems to not care. 
Sitting between the murray ward (orange zone) and cellier ( grene zone) observing staff crossing between the two. Going into the staricase between removing thire mask and giving hug's and telling each other have much they miss eachother.  to then go back to thire wards again. 
I find it baffeling and i cant see my new born because of cross contaninatiom risk. Its a joke

title: Very considerate and helpful.
body: Visited here for Coronavirus Vaccination. Had to queue for a little while but its worth it. All of the staff were very helpful with my mobility issues and all had caring attitudes. Thankyou.

title: Safe and efficient
body: Just been to the surgery for my Covid vaccine. I must give a big ‚Äòshout out‚Äô to all the staff for their amazing service. The whole procedure was orchestrated efficiently and safely. We really do appreciate the 5 star service you offer to your patients. Thank you so much.

title: Great Service for Covid Jabs
body: Excellent volunteers. From the car park people right through to the retired NHS staff administering the jabs. Thank you all. I was very impressed with how smooth an operation you are providing.

title: Great
body: I and my husband was getting our first vacation and the doctors and nurses were very kind and helpful

title: Chapel Allerton Leeds Great practice
body: Had my left eye Catrac done 13th March.2021 the nurses and Surgeon were so kind and explained every thing to me . As I was so nervous about my procedure.  Cannot Recomend this place and staff enough. Very kind and I felt relaxed. Thankyou so much kind regards Denise c

title: CV vaccination
body: The whole process from booking to the actual jab was extremely efficient and well-organised. Very impressed

title: Get YOUR JAB
body:
Get your jab done guys & get it done here!
Staff so friendly, efficient and informative.
Very reassuring, willing to answer any questions.
Please let‚Äôs do our bit to help the hard working staff & volunteers.
When invited book your jab here!

title: Fabulous service
body: I would like to Express my gratitude to all the lovely ladies at the surgery  who attempted to look after me and to keep me calm after an ambulance was called after going for an ecg on Friday 8th march.  Also the two paramedics who accompanied me were both amazing and looked after me really well so thank you also.  Also to the nurses and doctors that all treated me wonderfully at Russell's hall hospital you are all amazing.  Thank you all from the bottom of my heart for a fantastic service.  Also to the wonderful doctor at wordsley green for acting so thoroughly and quickly in sorting out my health options so quickly.

title: Very pleased with the service given
body: I have recently used the practice for my COVID vaccine, which was held in Salisbury Cathedral. Very efficient. I am very happy with the services they offer at Harcourt in general.

title: Radiology Department
body: My Mum who is 84 visited the radiology department on a Sunday for an ultrasound. She was over whelmed by the friendly staff, they were efficient, and went above and beyond to make my Mum feel totally relaxed and at ease. She could not speak highly enough of all of the staff she came in contact with on her visit. 5 stars. Well done team radiology.

title: St Mark's saved my life
body:
In early November, I was called in to St Marks Hospital for what appeared to be a routine colonoscopy, after a small abnormality appeared in my Bowel screening test results. 

Unfortunately, the colonoscopy found a tumour, as well as several polyps, which came as a terrible shock to me as you can imagine. 

Later, it was found that the tumour was indeed cancerous and, although it thankfully had not spread, needed to be removed urgently to prevent any further complications. 

With great luck, I had my surgery on February 4 this year, and am now cancer free and well in to my recovery. 

I am forever indebted to each and every member of the team at St Marks Hospital, from the colonoscopy, to the scans, all of the Colorectal cancer nurses and, especially, my remarkable surgeon - literally - enabled me to continue living my life to the full. 

We are so incredibly fortunate to have the NHS, especially during this time when our world is going through something we could never have imagined, and St Marks Hospital is a remarkable example of the NHS at its best. 

Thank you. From the bottom of my heart.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Thank you
body: I would like to thank all those involved in the Covid 19 vaccination effort. I am extremely nervous but all the people I encountered were so helpful.  The lovely lady at the door supported me through to the room for the vaccination and the doctor who carried it out was also so kind and did not make me feel stupid for being so frightened.

title: Vascular surgery
body: I was rushed in to A&E at Frimley Park from another hospital following a ruptured visceral artery in the pancreas. This team saved my life and I'm extremely grateful for all the medical and support staff who helped me. Not only did the two wards (Sadu and F2)  take great care of me medically, they also took great pains to make me feel that they were like my family for the time I was there. They cared for me like I was a family member. I have nothing but praise and gratitude for the brilliant team and especially the Vascular Consultants to whom I owe my life. Thank you so much.

title: Amazing staff & Care
body: My mum was taken in by ambulance from her care home after a fall. From the start to finish she was treated with  ultimate care! I cannot thank the staff enough - ambulance/paramedics 5 star - Auxiliary/healthcare assistants 5 star - Doctors 5 star - Nurses 5 star - transport ambulance service 5 star. Everyone of you treated my mum with respect dignity and care (she has dementia) You all are ALL amazing. Thanks for her speedy care. Everything was SUPER clean and tidy, we felt very safe and nothing was too much effort. üôè

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Covid Vaccination
body: My husband and I had our Covid jabs this morning. The experience was excellent. Extremely efficient process end to end and staff were professional, kind, considerate and welcoming. Thank you very much.

title: Caring staff even under pressure
body: Thankyou for your care of me while you are all under such pressure .I attended the department referred by my gp in a lot of pain and was immediately reassured and cared for so well by everyone

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpful and empathetic CBT therapy
body: My CBT therapist was brilliant at helping me challenge unhelpful thought patterns. She showed me ways to manage anxiety triggers and was incredibly supportive.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
The Rollout of the vaccine was very smooth and professionally handled all the staff were very Friendly Would Recommend
this practice

title: Exceptional service
body: I am a regular visitor to Higham Ferrers Surgery, I never have a problem booking or changing an appointment, the reception staff are always friendly and helpful and the medical staff are professional and informative. I have to give special mention to the nursing staff as it is them I see most often. I have two long standing leg ulcers, the nurses have gone out of their way to find the best and most effective treatment, I am always included in any decision making process, I am also given nutritional advice so a holistic approach is maintained. My most recent visit was for my first covid jab, I had heard of long queues at another surgery which concerns me as I am unable to stand for long periods. When I arrived at the surgery I was second in line, we were kept at a safe distance and details were checked twice. I was in the building less than ten minutes, after the mandatory wait I went home. The organisation was excellent.

title: Terrible would not recommend
body: Been with this surgery since moving to location 2 years ago and so many mistakes have been made. This year was the tipping point when I had excruciating pain and every few weeks had to go and they refused to do a referral to the right people or diagnosed me with something that it wasn't because of my age. Messed up the referral alongside medication I was on refused treatment even though I had a letter from a hospital. No communication. If you want to waste time join

title: Shocking care
body: The amount of noise made by night time staff is an absolute joke if they aren't banging around they're sat talking or shouting I've been in a few days and the most sleep I've had is when I was knocked out for surgery your supposed to be here healing and feeling better instead you end up stressed and sleep deprived there is no consideration for the patients welfare on this ward at night definitely must be the B team absolute disgrace

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good, if you can get past the receptionists.
body: Phoned 4 days in a row at 8am.  Waited in a queue for about an hour for each day to be told nothing available. Not even a phone call from a doctor or nurse was available?!  Was told on the 4th day if it was that bad, to go to A&E  (ambulances where queuing up outside at the time). Desperate and very worried, I phoned 111. Spoke to a nice lady who said I need to speak to a doctor.  Within an hour, a doctor phoned me back, asked my symptoms, told me I needed tests and a scan.  She email my surgery telling them and asked for a doctor to ring me.  I didn't raise my hopes!  About half hour later, a doctor from Long Catlis Surgery rang me, booked me in for various blood tests and my my scan tomorrow in Sittingbourne.  My advise, dont bother ringing the surgery, ring 111. They where really nice and I got results but had to go in a circle to do it.  Good Luck!

title: Clear explanation
body: Dr gave clear concise explanation of problem and actions going forward. Dr was polite and answered all my questions.

title: Awful
body: Spoke to a doctor to order my medication and asked him to put it on the spine.  He confirmed he had done it. When I tried to pick it up, it was not there . This is the 5 time this has happened. I have know run out of my medication again. I have spent the weekend in pain and now have been trying to sort this out for 3 hours and cant get hold of anybody.  Its just not good enough.

title: Oliver st
body: Good morning great experience with you guys but not sure about the Covid vaccination  booking notices ? I received a text message this very morning to book my vaccination but I booked my my vaccination on the 1/03/21 ?? Why are you 2 weeks out on theses schedules

title: Terrible phone service
body: Tried phoning 5 times and still no answer, the automated phone response keeps ending the call before I even get a chance to select my option. Absolutely terrible!

title: Very poor practice
body:
During the COVID pandemic the surgery has totally abandoned patient care, the GP‚Äôs refuse to see anyone and it is virtually impossible to get through on the telephone. The reception closed and in any event the reception staff are so rude and unhelpful they may as well not be there. Presumably, despite refusing to work, they continued to be paid. Very dissatisfied with the surgery, who also have made no effort to communicate why they were in effect ‚Äòon strike‚Äô.
I‚Äôm sure things were difficult, but patients have been treated abysmally over the past year.

title: Very well organised
body: I was very happy with my treatment. The COVID prevention measures were very good. The process and procedures were very well explained and the Operation went very smoothly.

title: Caring staff
body: I‚Äôve had several visits recently but the staff are always caring and compassionate, regardless of how busy they are. They make time to talk, actively listen and remember what I‚Äôve discussed in previous appointments.

title: Effortless
body: Registered with Wivenhoe surgery in January 2021.  Taking into account covid restrictions etc - it was straight forward.  We had a few appointments and referrals so far and all done promptly.  Exceeded our expectations and can't fault it in any way. Thank you.

title: They're good!
body:
The doctors I've spoke with were very helpful, understanding and professional. They made it easier for me to talk with them and I felt understood and safe. I cannot thank them enough!
The secretary staff is great too, reliable and helpful all the times!

title: Vaccination Jab
body: Just wanted to say a few words concerning the jab I received in the morning. Besides queuing outside prior to being allowed to go in to get the jab, the rest of the experience was great. The nurse explained everything clearly and it was done in a matter of minutes. Then all I had to do was wait 15 mins after as I was driving. Recommended and everyone should get one, I was even offered a date for the second jab :-)

title: This is a great Practice
body:
My Mother and I were very impressed with the medical practice during our visits to obtain the corona vaccine.  
All the Staff we spoke to beforehand to arrange these vaccines were very understanding and helpful and returned our calls.
keep up the good work and thank you very much to everyone concerned.

title: Good Experience
body: The clinic is swift in appointments. Its located near my home, very convenient for me, apart from that the staff is very caring and professional.

title: Many thanks to the team
body: Many thanks to all who cared for me so well when I came for an Endoscopy last Friday - the way you looked after me is much appreciated!

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent care and attention
body: I am extremely satisfied with the level of care and attention I‚Äôve had at Lea vale main centre and at Bushmead which is so close to me. All the receptionist are first class. So polite and willing to listen and help. The chat service is amazing and I use that a lot. Of course the Doctors are really good too! I prefer some to others but honestly I think they all have a caring attitude. Thank you all so much for helping over the various health issues I‚Äôve been encountered.

title: Fantastic
body: I‚Äôve just been for my Covid 19 vaccination and was in and out in 3 minutes. In those 3 minutes I was made to feel incredibly welcome, informed about the vaccine and what was to be expected, vaccinated and sent on my way. The organisation here is outstanding, the staff working today are fantastic. Well done and thank you.

title: Improved Reception Staff
body: The Doctors at the surgery in my experience are very caring and professional. The receptionists over the years have been very rude, disrespectful every time you speak to them, however today I have spoken with staff at reception I think she has been employed recently. She is efficient, well-mannered and compassionate and definitely there has been a big improvement.

title: EXCELLENT PRACTICE
body: I have always received excellent service from this practice.  My two doctors have always gone the extra mile with my concerns.  Very thorough, caring and fantastic service.  Thank you for being excellent doctors.

title: Excellent service
body: Always great service from this practice and so well organised for COVID vaccine too, thank you to all at Staploe for their hard work!

title: Wonderful service
body:
Had a blood test today,seamless. What a fantastic service, we're lucky to have them, thank you. 
Considering the chalenges at the moment, the NHS do a wonderful job.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: From the 999 call via the WMA to the SaTH everything was superlative. The necessary analysis, medication and CT/MRI scans found exactly what the issue was. However, the treatment is elsewhere at Royal Stoke Neurosurgery starting a week later. The transfer of information within both Hospitals, to my family and myself was timely and complete. Every person treated me and the situation really calmly with full compassion. I have never had such a brilliant experience at any establishment or Hospital. Very many thanks to all who have placed the first vital stage in resolving my brain tumour issue.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Very reassuring check of my eyes
body: Had a very red/sore eye and asked my optician dispenser at Suzanne Floyd, Craven Arms for his opinion. He referred my to his optician who was able to see me very quickly. I had what appeared to be a very full and careful check of both eyes and was recommended anti histamine eye drops which seemed to sort out the problem.  I appreciate that I was lucky to have been seen so quickly. I was very impressed with the quality of my check up and would recommend this practice to anyone in need of an eyecare check up. I was told that if my problem had been more serious then I would have been referred for a hospital review.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Never have a problem booking appointments. Staff friendly and helpful. Brilliant gp surgery. This is our family surgery and we are very pleased with the service provided.

title: Excellent Hospital
body: I have just undergone cataract surgery as an NHS patient and would like to thank everyone, I was extremely nervous and everyone from the receptionist to the consultant and the nurses were kind, patient and re-assuring, I would definitely recommend Woodlands.

title: Quick, efficient, service
body: Went online to see if I could have a minor surgical procedure. Had an appt within 2 days and surgery was painlessly done at giggs practice in 5 days. Thank you

title: Great Practice
body: I can‚Äôt say enough how amazing BMI was. From the start the person who welcomed us in was understanding friendly and welcoming. Then was seen very quickly after turning up and even seen early!! The man who saw me was so friendly and haveing anxiety made me feel so comfortable about being there. Told me everything he was doing, spoke to me about everything he was doing keeping it simple for me to completely understand and feel happy. All staff there was lovely and i would reccommend anyone needing eyes checked etc to go to this very friendly hospital!!

title: Receptionist today
body: The receptionist today was very polite and very helpful when dealing with my problems today. The team was amazing and was able to provide excellent care. Thank you so much.

title: Fantastic Care
body:
The standards of professional and service care delivery are truly outstanding. The communication was excellent, and there were no issues that were not readily/immediately addressed.  I was fully informed , and my surgery and aftercare were both detailed and delivered compassionately. Catering and domestic were wonderful, and I must say that I was very impressed with all members of staff. My special thanks to anaesthetics and recovery staff.
Rooms:  Immaculate, well furnished and thoroughly clean. Beds. Very comfortable . Alarm and service call in all rooms with quick responses. I am an NHS patient , lucky enough to have been treated surgically at the Fitzwilliam, and I hope to return there for further surgery soom. Great staff, great teams and wonderful personal service.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: I didn't have to wait long for an appointment and the experience was efficient and professional. All the staff are very approachable and friendly.

title: Covid vaccination
body: Recently attended the surgery for my Covid vaccination. Very well organised and friendly professional staff.

title: Superb care, very well organised service
body: Entering the hospital for surgery via reception was very well organised and you were soon taken to a cubicle where the surgeon and anaesthetist met you, plus nurses for pre-op checks. Everyone was very kind and calm and you felt you were in the hands of a well practised care system. After the operation I was soon back in my private en suite room on the ward, with lovely views across the fields. I was on my feet with the physios in the afternoon and a whole range of nurses and cheerful health care assistants were constantly checking on me. The hospitality team that served food were very well dressed, polite and happy and the menu to choose from was extensive and good quality. Everyone, including the porters and the cleaners were polite and cheerful. It seemed like they all enjoyed working at Circle. It seems harsh to compare this hospital with an NHS hospital when we know the staff are struggling to do a great job (and mostly achieving it), particularly post Covid, with not enough government funding but being in a building that was well designed, with good decor and having a quiet private room without hearing other patients at nights aided my recovery. Things happen on time which again is the beauty of a hospital dedicated to elective surgery and not having to deal with emergency admissions. I felt thoroughly well cared for and it such a shame that the NHS cannot hope to match this experience due to lack of funding and bureaucracy.

title: Amazing
body: Contacted the surgery following health concerns, used the App which was an easy and efficient way to arrange a triage consultation.  Was contacted by phone discussed symptoms and was offered a face to face appointment and seen within 4 hours from original contact. Was seen by the same GP who provided triage thus having consistency of care and no need to repeat symptoms.  Given a thorough examination and my symptoms explained to me in a way that allowed me to fully understand what the symptoms were and what they meant.  Was treated with dignity and respect and in a very reassuring manner.  Left the surgery feeling relieved and pleased with the service I was offered.  Thanks

title: Life savers
body: A now retired Dr from Wivenhoe Surgery reacted very quickly when I had a heart scare. I saw the Dr on the Tuesday and had angioplasty on the Thursday. I didn't know it but could have died at any time. I meet them occasionally ony exercise walk and am extremely grateful for their swift reaction. Since then I have found the staff at all levels are excellent. I find Patient Access extremely useful for contact and prescription repeats. Keep up the good work team!

title: First Class Service
body: I contacted online for an appointment, filled in the online form, I received a response almost immediately, and a request for a photo, acknowledged straight away after sending all links clear and easy to understand, within 2 hours received notice of a prescription, causes etc. & advice, First class all round given link & choices of Location for blood test cannot ask for anything more thank you

title: Excellent all round practice
body: From the phone call to the receptionist who I have always found very helpful to the Nurse or GP the whole experiance for me has been 100%, even over the past year when it has been very difficult for everyone their standards have not dropped

title: Efficient, friendly and on the ball
body: Can‚Äôt speak highly enough of this practice. Friendly support staff, efficient doctors available at short notice when needed, referrals followed up quickly, I feel in very good hands.

title: Fantastic care!
body:
I had a MRI today 15.3.2021 at 8am this morning! The staff that gave me it was so kind and really caring, even with this tough time with covid they couldn't have done enough for me, they explain everything that was going to happen and everything they did, they told me what they were going to do it before they did, it was a young lady and lad and they worked so well together! I really wanted to leave this review to let others know how kind they were, they made me feel so at ease, even when I was in the MRI they spoke to me to make sure i was ok and told me what was going to happen next! But to also say thank you to them!! MRI can be quite a daunting feeling but they both had such calm and kind personalities that it just made me feel so much more at ease. I would also like to say that the receptionists were also very kind. So thank you to all that helped me this morning! From the radiologists that did my MRI to the receptionist!
I would recommend this unit and anyone that is feeling a bit anxious about going please know you will be in the best care ever. Thank you again

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great support
body: Have been with practice for over 30 years, they have been of great support with my continuing bad health. The nurses, doctors, and reception staff are very nice, professional and caring

title: Extremely helpful
body:
On the 20 February I visited the practice after referral from the out of hours duty doctor. I was seen by a doctor who took a lot of time to arrange for me to be seen by the hospital the same day. This led to my being admitted to the Surgical Assessment Unit on the following Monday and to receive treatment for a post operative problem after numerous scans and blood tests. I had a drain fitted to my abdomen and was discharged after 5 days in hospital. 
The Walk-in Centre's doctor demonstrated concern, patience and determination that I should be seen that day and I am extremely grateful.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly & professional practice
body: I have used this practice on various occasions over the past 18 months for  injuries which have required physio. I have been 100% happy with the treatment I have received in term of hands on physio and also with the exercises that have I been  encouraged to do at home to aid recovery. Would not hesitate in recommending them.

title: Amazing staff
body: I had to go to A&E for a both a physical and mental health issue. The staff were all friendly and amazingly helpful, going out of their way to make sure I was as well looked after and comfortable as possible. I could not have wished for better help.

title: Really helpful
body:
I have been really amazed at how good Buckden surgery has been. 
Everyone there has been compassionate, kind and this has been underpinned by their excellent communication skills.

Each staff member has been really fabulous and supportive in the way they have interacted with me. This includes the helpful receptionists who have done a great gob in gathering information and being kind as they do so. 

The great phlebotomists who were supportive and informative. 

Of course the GPS themselves who have had the best communication skills I‚Äôve seen. They are able to show compassion, kindness and have been very thoughtful. They have Explained things very well and answered questions. I have really appreciated this. That all goes without saying I appreciate their skills and knowledge.

title: Excellent practice
body: Easy to make an appointment, efficient system with very little waiting time.I saw a trainee GP, she was easy to talk to, listened carefully and took my concerns seriously. Referral for further investigation made promptly.

title: Fantastic surgery and caring staff
body: I have used the surgery for years and staff are always kind and compassionate, willing to listen and help where they can. They usually answer the phone quickly and fit you in as soon as they can. I haven‚Äôt experienced any undue delay in being seen with real serious concerns. During the pandemic their service has still been great with quick responses to email and phone queries. I am really happy with them as a practice and would recommend to others.

title: Shocking
body: I have been ringing the surgery for an appointment since 8.30 I have been put on hold for about an hour overall and the phone being put down due to staff being busy I have made 17 calls I finally get through and there are no appointments yet again this has happened numerous times this doctors is absolutely useless

title: Covid booking - call is ended unexpectedly
body:
I received a text saying I should call to book my Covid test. When I call and select option 1 (for Covid tests) the call is ended unexpectedly. This has happened multiple times.

There are no notifications for me on the Dr. IQ app.

When I call I select a different option (6) I get the same issue as another user - tells me I am customer x in the queue and I stay on the line for over 30 mins and when I get to caller no 1 I am told they cannot answer due to high call volumes!!! Ridiculous!!

title: Kind Staff
body: I had an unexpected overnight stay following what I thought would be a short A&E trip. I was very frightened and upset as I had a baby at home and wasn't expecting to be leaving him for so long. All the staff who treated me could not have been kinder or made me feel more at ease. What could have been a very stressful night was made easier by their support. It was particularly appreciated when one of the sisters proactively brought me a more comfortable bed even though I hadn't asked for one. I cannot fault the treatment I received.

title: Outstanding care
body: I had my prostate removed on the 5th January and from the moment I arrived until my discharge 2 days later the care I received from everyone involved in my operation and aftercare was outstanding. We are very lucky to have such brilliant surgeons and wonderful nursing staff.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Covid Vaccine Great Service
body: Just want to say a BIG THANKS to the staff on Saturday 13 March when I had my Covid Vaccine.  And to all the moaners standing in the queue who just couldn‚Äôt be bothered to wait patiently shame on you!
